overview: This measure has been amended to establish requirements for kauhale projects, including reporting requirements by the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [16] The measure also requires the Auditor to conduct a management and performance audit of the Kauhale Initiative and establishes the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program. [16] [16] Your Committee on Conference has also deleted language that would have appropriated funds for supportive housing projects and supportive services for certain households in those projects. [16]
appropriations: The Committee on Conference has inserted appropriation amounts of $18,575,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $24,325,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the Kauhale Initiative. [16] Additionally, appropriation amounts of $2,525,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $5,855,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 have been inserted for the continued implementation of the Ohana Zones Pilot Program. [16]
agency_impact: The measure now requires the Auditor to conduct a management and performance audit of the Kauhale Initiative and report to the Legislature. [16] The Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions is now required to submit a report every four months to the Legislature detailing the expenditure of funds. [16] [16] The bill also specifies that the Coordinator on Homelessness shall report directly to the Director of Human Services. [16]
policy_impact: This measure has been amended by establishing the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program within the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [16] Language that would have appropriated funds for supportive housing projects and supportive services has been deleted. [16] The effective date has also been changed to July 1, 2025. [16]
six_year_fiscal_implications: This measure inserts appropriation amounts of $18,575,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $24,325,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the Kauhale Initiative. [16] It also inserts appropriation amounts of $2,525,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $5,855,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the Ohana Zones Program. [16] Establishing the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program implies ongoing costs beyond the initial two-year appropriation. [16] The measure also requires the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to submit a report every four months to the Legislature, which may have minor, ongoing administrative costs. [16] [16]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The establishment of the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program within the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions will result in ongoing fiscal obligations for the state after the initial six-year period. [16]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The Committee on Conference has amended this measure by inserting specific appropriation amounts for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Program for FY 2025-2026 and FY 2026-2027. [16] [16] The Ohana Zones Program has been established as a permanent program, a significant change from its previous pilot status. [16] New requirements include an audit of the Kauhale Initiative by the Auditor and quarterly expenditure reports from the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [16] [16] The measure also deletes appropriations for supportive housing projects and changes the effective date to July 1, 2025. [16] [16]
